examples.note: This is a Latin example, as the word is rarely used in modern English.

etymology.value: From Latin *dēlēō*, meaning "I destroy, blot out, erase, delete".

usage_notes.explanation: *Deleo* is a Latin verb, meaning "I delete". It is very rarely used in modern English, and *delete* is the preferred term. It might be encountered in highly formal or academic contexts, or when quoting Latin.

readability_explanation.text: *Deleo* is a Latin verb meaning "to delete". It is almost never used in modern English; *delete* is the standard term. You might encounter it in very formal writing or in Latin quotations.
